question_sentence: Which region did President Donald Trump visit this week?
evidence: President Trump completed a diplomatic tour in Asia, where he met with key leaders. On Thursday, a landmark trade summit took place between Trump and Chinese leader Xi Jinping — their first face-to-face meeting in six years.

question_sentence: Which country was among the hardest hit when Hurricane Melissa tore through the Caribbean this week?
evidence: Melissa made landfall in Jamaica as one of the strongest Atlantic hurricanes on record. The storm also caused severe damage in Cuba, Haiti and the Bahamas.

question_sentence: Which program could be paused in November due to the government shutdown?
evidence: In an unprecedented situation, millions of Americans could lose access to the crucial food assistance program SNAP — the formal name for food stamps — due to the federal government shutdown.

question_sentence: Millions watched the MLB World Series this week. Which two teams battled for the championship?
choices: New York Yankees and Boston Red Sox
Los Angeles Dodgers and Toronto Blue Jays
evidence: The Toronto Blue Jays faced off against the Los Angeles Dodgers in the 2025 MLB World Series.

question_sentence: Which company topped $5 trillion in market value this week?
evidence: AI chipmaker Nvidia became the first publicly traded company to surpass $5 trillion in market value — the same week that Apple topped the $4 trillion mark for the first time.

question_sentence: The Federal Reserve recently cut interest rates to their lowest level in how many years?
evidence: The Federal Reserve lowered its benchmark lending rate to a range between 3.75% and 4%, the lowest in three years.

question_sentence: Which country may soon no longer be classified as measles-free?
evidence: Canada is poised to lose its measles elimination status — and the US could too. A country is no longer considered to be measles-free if the virus returns and transmission is sustained continuously for more than a year, according to the World Health Organization.

question_sentence: Which celebration began in Mexico City this week?
evidence: Día de los Muertos (Day of the Dead) celebrations occurred in Mexico City, with hundreds taking to the streets dressed as La Catrina, the iconic Mexican skeleton figure.

question_sentence: Which group received $0 paychecks this week in the US?
evidence: Air traffic controllers across the US received $0 paychecks this week as the government shutdown continues to leave tens of thousands of federal workers without pay.

question_sentence: A newly discovered book by which famous author is set to be published next year?
evidence: A newly found Dr. Seuss book titled “Sing the 50 United States!” will be published next year.
